natural problem: Calculate the whole number remainder when 987,670 is divided by 128.
natural solution: $$ So the remainder is $\boxed{22}$. $$\text{-OR-}$$ Assuming use of a calculator, we can divide $987,\!670$ by 128 to find that the quotient is between 7716 and 7717.
Subtracting the product of 7716 and 128 from $987,\!670$ gives $\boxed{22}$.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: int
assumes h0 : "a = 987670"
and h1 : "b = 128"
shows  "a mod b = 22"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Calculate the whole number remainder when 987,670 is divided by 128. The final Answer is 22
 ### Proof
 We long divide as follows: $$ \begin{array}{c|c@{\hspace{0pt}}c@{\hspace{0pt}}c@{\hspace{0pt}}c@{\hspace{0pt}}c@{\hspace{0pt}}c@{\hspace{0pt}}c@{\hspace{0pt}}c} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & & & 7 & 7 & 1 & 6 & \\
 \cline{2-8} 128 && 9&8&7&6&7&0 \\ \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & 8 & 9 & 6 &&&& \\ \cline{3-5} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & & 9 & 1 & 6 &&& \\ \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & & 8 & 9 & 6 &&& \\ \cline{4-6} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & & & 2 & 0 & 7 && \\
 \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & & & 1 & 2 & 8 && \\ \cline{5-7} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & & & & 7 & 9 & 0 & \\ \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & & & & 7 & 6 & 8 & \\ \cline{6-8} \multicolumn{2}{r}{} & & & & & 2 & 2 & \\ \end{array}
 $$ So the remainder is $\boxed{22}$. $$\text{-OR-}$$ Assuming use of a calculator, we can divide $987,\!670$ by 128 to find that the quotient is between 7716 and 7717.
 Subtracting the product of 7716 and 128 from $987,\!670$ gives $\boxed{22}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: int
assumes h0 : "a = 987670"
and h1 : "b = 128"
shows  "a mod b = 22"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the remainder when 987670 is divided by 128. The final answer is 22.
